title: G4MF Asset Header
description: The asset header of a G4MF file. This contains metadata that applies to the entire file, such as the dimension, the version, and what tool generated the file.

dimension.description: The dimension of the G4MF file. This is the number of dimensions in the geometry represented by the file. All data in the file, such as mesh vertices and node transforms, MUST be in this dimension. For 4D files, this will be 4.

extensionsRequired.description: An array of all extensions required to load this G4MF file. If an extension is required and an implementation does not support that extension, the implementation MUST NOT load this file, and instead SHOULD return an error. If an extension is required, it MUST also be listed in the `'extensionsUsed'` array.

extensionsUsed.description: An array of all extensions used in this G4MF file. If an extension is used in `'extensions'` anywhere in the file, or in `'extensionsRequired'`, it MUST be listed here.

extensionDependencies.description: An object mapping extensions to arrays of extensions that they depend on. If an extension inhibits the ability of another extension to function correctly, it MUST be listed here, except if both are already listed in `'extensionsRequired'`. If an implementation supports an extension, but does not support one of its dependencies, the implementation SHOULD ignore the data of that extension, treating the file as if the extension was not present.

generator.description: The name of the tool that generated this G4MF file. This is intended for informational purposes. This SHOULD include the version of the tool.

specification.description: An optional link to the G4MF specification that the file adheres to. This is intended for informational purposes when manually inspecting a file, and SHOULD NOT be used by implementations for any functional purpose.

thumbnail.description: The index of the texture containing the thumbnail image(s) for this file. This MUST be a 2D texture. Sampling, filtering, and wrapping properties do not apply to the thumbnail.

version.description: The version of the G4MF file format. This is intended for informational purposes. When defined, it MUST be in the format `MAJOR.MINOR` or `MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH`.
